Introduction
About this Manual
This manual is about &MiKTeX;: the purpose of this manual is not to give an introduction into the world of &TeX;. If you are not familiar with using &TeX; (and Friends), then please consider reading one of the tutorials available on the Internet.
&features;
How to Get &MiKTeX;
MiKTeX getting
&MiKTeX; is available on the &CTAN;
Comprehenisive TeX Archive Network and on &CDR;/&DVDminR;.
Downloading from &CTAN;
MiKTeX downloading
You can download &MiKTeX; from &CTAN; with the help of &MiKTeXNetInstaller; (see ).
&MiKTeX; on &CDR;/&DVDminR;
If you cannot easily download more than 400 MB (the complete &MiKTeX; distribution), then you may wish to obtain a copy of the &MiKTeX; &CDR;/&DVDminR;. Visit the CD-R/DVD-R info page, for more information.
CD-R obtaining
CD-R running MiKTeX from the
MiKTeX CD-R
MiKTeX CD-R
The &MiKTeX; &CDR; allows you to install &MiKTeX; on the hard-disk or to run the programs directly from the &CDR;.
Related Applications
There are other applications you might be interested in installing:
ActivePerl
ActivePerl is an implementation of Perl for Windows. A few utilities (e.g., ConTeXt) are Perl scripts. You should install ActivePerl, if you want to use these utilities.
Perl getting
ActivePerl
&AdobeReader;
&AdobeReader; is a &PDF; document viewer.
PDF viewing
Adobe Reader getting
DebugView
DebugView is a freeware application that lets you monitor diagnostic messages produced by &MiKTeX;. You can download DebugView from the Sysinternals web site.
DebugView getting
&TeXnicCenter;
&TeXnicCenter; is a freeware &TeX; editor/shell. It cooperates with &MiKTeX; with respect to forward and inverse &DVI;
